course_info.Course Title: PWM-Security: Security Risk Analysis (Assess and Address Security Risks)
Learning Outcomes: LO1: Apply basic risk identification techniques to detect tell-tale signs and symptoms of potential security threats.
LO2: Follow organizational procedures to identify risks by recognizing surveillance, inappropriate behavior, or potential threats.
LO3: Analyze situations and relate them to prior experiences to identify suspicious activities, attire, or explosive devices.
LO4: Collaborate with security teams to assess risks using established methods of risk analysis.
course_info.TSC Title: Security Risk Analysis Assess and Address Security Risks

analyst_responses.What are the performance gaps in the ind: A key challenge is the ability to proactively identify potential security threats. Many professionals struggle to recognize early warning signs and subtle indicators that could signal an impending issue. Often, responses are reactive rather than preventative, leading to increased vulnerability and potential breaches.
analyst_responses.Why do you think this WSQ course will ad: This course equips personnel with the skills to notice abnormalities and relate them to potential risks. By learning to spot tell-tale signs and unusual activities, individuals can enhance their ability to anticipate and mitigate threats before they escalate. This proactive approach strengthens the overall defense posture.
